00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  * Typedefs and defines for working with Octeon physical addresses.
00043  *
00044  * <hr>$Revision: 38306 $<hr>
00045 */
00046 #ifndef __CVMX_ADDRESS_H__
00047 #define __CVMX_ADDRESS_H__
00048 
00049 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00050 #include "cvmx-abi.h"
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00054 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00055 extern "C" {
00056 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 typedef enum {
00060     CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XKSEG = 3LL,
00061     CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XKPHYS = 2LL,
00062     CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XSSEG = 1LL,
00063     CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XUSEG = 0LL
00064 } cvmx_mips_space_t;
00065 
00066 typedef enum {
00067     CVMX_MIPS_XKSEG_SPACE_KSEG0 = 0LL,
00068     CVMX_MIPS_XKSEG_SPACE_KSEG1 = 1LL,
00069     CVMX_MIPS_XKSEG_SPACE_SSEG = 2LL,
00070     CVMX_MIPS_XKSEG_SPACE_KSEG3 = 3LL
00071 } cvmx_mips_xkseg_space_t;
00072 
00073     /* decodes <14:13> of a kseg3 window address */
00074 typedef enum {
00075     CVMX_ADD_WIN_SCR = 0L,
00076     CVMX_ADD_WIN_DMA = 1L,  /* see cvmx_add_win_dma_dec_t for further decode */
00077     CVMX_ADD_WIN_UNUSED = 2L,
00078     CVMX_ADD_WIN_UNUSED2 = 3L
00079 } cvmx_add_win_dec_t;
00080 
00081     /* decode within DMA space */
00082 typedef enum {
00083     CVMX_ADD_WIN_DMA_ADD = 0L,  /* add store data to the write buffer entry, allocating it if necessary */
00084     CVMX_ADD_WIN_DMA_SENDMEM = 1L,  /* send out the write buffer entry to DRAM */
00085     /* store data must be normal DRAM memory space address in this case */
00086     CVMX_ADD_WIN_DMA_SENDDMA = 2L,  /* send out the write buffer entry as an IOBDMA command */
00087     /* see CVMX_ADD_WIN_DMA_SEND_DEC for data contents */
00088     CVMX_ADD_WIN_DMA_SENDIO = 3L,   /* send out the write buffer entry as an IO write */
00089     /* store data must be normal IO space address in this case */
00090     CVMX_ADD_WIN_DMA_SENDSINGLE = 4L,   /* send out a single-tick command on the NCB bus */
00091     /* no write buffer data needed/used */
00092 } cvmx_add_win_dma_dec_t;
00093 
00094 /**
00095  *   Physical Address Decode
00096  *
00097  * Octeon-I HW never interprets this X (<39:36> reserved
00098  * for future expansion), software should set to 0.
00099  *
00100  *  - 0x0 XXX0 0000 0000 to      DRAM         Cached
00101  *  - 0x0 XXX0 0FFF FFFF
00102  *
00103  *  - 0x0 XXX0 1000 0000 to      Boot Bus     Uncached  (Converted to 0x1 00X0 1000 0000
00104  *  - 0x0 XXX0 1FFF FFFF         + EJTAG                           to 0x1 00X0 1FFF FFFF)
00105  *
00106  *  - 0x0 XXX0 2000 0000 to      DRAM         Cached
00107  *  - 0x0 XXXF FFFF FFFF
00108  *
00109  *  - 0x1 00X0 0000 0000 to      Boot Bus     Uncached
00110  *  - 0x1 00XF FFFF FFFF
00111  *
00112  *  - 0x1 01X0 0000 0000 to      Other NCB    Uncached
00113  *  - 0x1 FFXF FFFF FFFF         devices
00114  *
00115  * Decode of all Octeon addresses
00116  */
00117 typedef union {
00118 
00119     uint64_t u64;
00120 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00121     struct {
00122         cvmx_mips_space_t R:2;
00123         uint64_t offset:62;
00124     } sva;          /* mapped or unmapped virtual address */
00125 
00126     struct {
00127         uint64_t zeroes:33;
00128         uint64_t offset:31;
00129     } suseg;        /* mapped USEG virtual addresses (typically) */
00130 
00131     struct {
00132         uint64_t ones:33;
00133         cvmx_mips_xkseg_space_t sp:2;
00134         uint64_t offset:29;
00135     } sxkseg;       /* mapped or unmapped virtual address */
00136 
00137     struct {
00138         cvmx_mips_space_t R:2;  /* CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XKPHYS in this case */
00139         uint64_t cca:3; /* ignored by octeon */
00140         uint64_t mbz:10;
00141         uint64_t pa:49; /* physical address */
00142     } sxkphys;      /* physical address accessed through xkphys unmapped virtual address */
00143 
00144     struct {
00145         uint64_t mbz:15;
00146         uint64_t is_io:1;   /* if set, the address is uncached and resides on MCB bus */
00147         uint64_t did:8; /* the hardware ignores this field when is_io==0, else device ID */
00148         uint64_t unaddr:4;  /* the hardware ignores <39:36> in Octeon I */
00149         uint64_t offset:36;
00150     } sphys;        /* physical address */
00151 
00152     struct {
00153         uint64_t zeroes:24; /* techically, <47:40> are dont-cares */
00154         uint64_t unaddr:4;  /* the hardware ignores <39:36> in Octeon I */
00155         uint64_t offset:36;
00156     } smem;         /* physical mem address */
00157 
00158     struct {
00159         uint64_t mem_region:2;
00160         uint64_t mbz:13;
00161         uint64_t is_io:1;   /* 1 in this case */
00162         uint64_t did:8; /* the hardware ignores this field when is_io==0, else device ID */
00163         uint64_t unaddr:4;  /* the hardware ignores <39:36> in Octeon I */
00164         uint64_t offset:36;
00165     } sio;          /* physical IO address */
00166 
00167     struct {
00168         uint64_t ones:49;
00169         cvmx_add_win_dec_t csrdec:2;    /* CVMX_ADD_WIN_SCR (0) in this case */
00170         uint64_t addr:13;
00171     } sscr;         /* scratchpad virtual address - accessed through a window at the end of kseg3 */
00172 
00173     /* there should only be stores to IOBDMA space, no loads */
00174     struct {
00175         uint64_t ones:49;
00176         cvmx_add_win_dec_t csrdec:2;    /* CVMX_ADD_WIN_DMA (1) in this case */
00177         uint64_t unused2:3;
00178         cvmx_add_win_dma_dec_t type:3;
00179         uint64_t addr:7;
00180     } sdma;         /* IOBDMA virtual address - accessed through a window at the end of kseg3 */
00181 
00182     struct {
00183         uint64_t didspace:24;
00184         uint64_t unused:40;
00185     } sfilldidspace;
00186 #else
00187     struct {
00188         uint64_t offset:62;
00189         cvmx_mips_space_t R:2;
00190     } sva;
00191 
00192     struct {
00193         uint64_t offset:31;
00194         uint64_t zeroes:33;
00195     } suseg;
00196 
00197     struct {
00198         uint64_t offset:29;
00199         cvmx_mips_xkseg_space_t sp:2;
00200         uint64_t ones:33;
00201     } sxkseg;
00202 
00203     struct {
00204         uint64_t pa:49;
00205         uint64_t mbz:10;
00206         uint64_t cca:3;
00207         cvmx_mips_space_t R:2;
00208     } sxkphys;
00209 
00210     struct {
00211         uint64_t offset:36;
00212         uint64_t unaddr:4;
00213         uint64_t did:8;
00214         uint64_t is_io:1;
00215         uint64_t mbz:15;
00216     } sphys;
00217 
00218     struct {
00219         uint64_t offset:36;
00220         uint64_t unaddr:4;
00221         uint64_t zeroes:24;
00222     } smem;
00223 
00224     struct {
00225         uint64_t offset:36;
00226         uint64_t unaddr:4;
00227         uint64_t did:8;
00228         uint64_t is_io:1;
00229         uint64_t mbz:13;
00230         uint64_t mem_region:2;
00231     } sio;
00232 
00233     struct {
00234         uint64_t addr:13;
00235         cvmx_add_win_dec_t csrdec:2;
00236         uint64_t ones:49;
00237     } sscr;
00238 
00239     struct {
00240         uint64_t addr:7;
00241         cvmx_add_win_dma_dec_t type:3;
00242         uint64_t unused2:3;
00243         cvmx_add_win_dec_t csrdec:2;
00244         uint64_t ones:49;
00245     } sdma;
00246 
00247     struct {
00248         uint64_t unused:40;
00249         uint64_t didspace:24;
00250     } sfilldidspace;
00251 #endif
00252 } cvmx_addr_t;
00253 
00254 /* These macros for used by 32 bit applications */
00255 
00256 #define CVMX_MIPS32_SPACE_KSEG0 1l
00257 #define CVMX_ADD_SEG32(segment, add)          (((int32_t)segment << 31) | (int32_t)(add))
00258 
00259 /* Currently all IOs are performed using XKPHYS addressing. Linux uses the
00260     CvmMemCtl register to enable XKPHYS addressing to IO space from user mode.
00261     Future OSes may need to change the upper bits of IO addresses. The
00262     following define controls the upper two bits for all IO addresses generated
00263     by the simple executive library */
00264 #define CVMX_IO_SEG CVMX_MIPS_SPACE_XKPHYS
00265 
00266 /* These macros simplify the process of creating common IO addresses */
00267 #define CVMX_ADD_SEG(segment, add)          ((((uint64_t)segment) << 62) | (add))
00268 #ifndef CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG
00269 #define CVMX_ADD_IO_SEG(add)                CVMX_ADD_SEG(CVMX_IO_SEG, (add))
00270 #endif
00271 #define CVMX_ADDR_DIDSPACE(did)             (((CVMX_IO_SEG) << 22) | ((1ULL) << 8) | (did))
00272 #define CVMX_ADDR_DID(did)                  (CVMX_ADDR_DIDSPACE(did) << 40)
00273 #define CVMX_FULL_DID(did,subdid)           (((did) << 3) | (subdid))
00274 
00275     /* from include/ncb_rsl_id.v */
00276 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_MIS 0ULL   /* misc stuff */
00277 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_GMX0 1ULL
00278 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_GMX1 2ULL
00279 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_PCI 3ULL
00280 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_KEY 4ULL
00281 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_FPA 5ULL
00282 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_DFA 6ULL
00283 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_ZIP 7ULL
00284 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_RNG 8ULL
00285 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_IPD 9ULL
00286 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_PKT 10ULL
00287 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TIM 11ULL
00288 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG 12ULL
00289     /* the rest are not on the IO bus */
00290 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_L2C 16ULL
00291 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_LMC 17ULL
00292 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_SPX0 18ULL
00293 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_SPX1 19ULL
00294 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_PIP 20ULL
00295 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_ASX0 22ULL
00296 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_ASX1 23ULL
00297 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_IOB 30ULL
00298 
00299 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_PKT_SEND       CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_PKT,2ULL)
00300 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_SWTAG      CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG,0ULL)
00301 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG1       CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG,1ULL)
00302 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG2       CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG,2ULL)
00303 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG3       CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG,3ULL)
00304 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_NULL_RD    CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG,4ULL)
00305 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_TAG5       CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG,5ULL)
00306 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG_CSR        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_TAG,7ULL)
00307 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_FAU_FAI        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_IOB,0ULL)
00308 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_TIM_CSR        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_TIM,0ULL)
00309 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_KEY_RW         CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_KEY,0ULL)
00310 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_PCI_6          CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_PCI,6ULL)
00311 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_MIS_BOO        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_MIS,0ULL)
00312 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_PCI_RML        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_PCI,0ULL)
00313 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_IPD_CSR        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_IPD,7ULL)
00314 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_DFA_CSR        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_DFA,7ULL)
00315 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_MIS_CSR        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_MIS,7ULL)
00316 #define CVMX_OCT_DID_ZIP_CSR        CVMX_FULL_DID(CVMX_OCT_DID_ZIP,0ULL)

00318 /* Cast to unsigned long long, mainly for use in printfs. */
00319 #define CAST_ULL(v) ((unsigned long long) (v))

00321 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00322 #ifdef CVMX_ABI_N32
00323 #define UNMAPPED_PTR(x) ( (1U << 31) | x )
00324 #else
00325 #define UNMAPPED_PTR(x) ( (1ULL << 63) | x )
00326 #endif
00327 #endif
